column1: #Text=George Bush discusses Iraq 5 years after invasion
#Text=George W. Bush , the President of the United States delivered today a speech regarding Iraq and the " global war on terror . "
#Text=Bush claimed that the war in Iraq had been successful .
#Text=He said that " removing Saddam Hussein from power was the right decision — and this is a fight America can and must win . "
#Text=The speech marked five years since the start of the Iraq War .

#Text=Bush said that " five years into this battle [ the war in Iraq ] , there is an understandable debate over whether the war was worth fighting , whether the fight is worth winning , and whether we can win it .

#Text=The answers are clear to me : Removing Saddam Hussein from power was the right decision — and this is a fight America can and must win .

_	_	_	_

#Text=He continued saying that  The men and women who crossed into Iraq five years ago removed a tyrant , liberated a country , and rescued millions from unspeakable horrors .

#Text=No one would argue that this war has not come at a high cost in lives and treasure — but those costs are necessary when we consider the cost of a strategic victory for our enemies in Iraq .

#Text=Bush concluded the speech by saying that  The best way we can honor them [ the US troops ] is by making sure that their sacrifice was not in vain .
